Reviews.Title: Two years and out!
Reviews.Author: Arly
Reviews.Content: We've loved this beautiful tv.  It has great features and the picture is wonderful.  But now that it is 2 years old, it has started to manifest similar picture problems to what others have mentioned here.  (Screen going dark in some areas, ghosting, etc.)  Too expensive to repair.Obviously, this Sony is built with such low quality that a large number of them start to fail at about the two year mark.  Great, I love to have to buy a new $2600 tele every two years!  I just bought a second Sony LCD for another room and wish I hadn't.  I expect much more from a company.  Sony, shame on you for not issuing a recall; you won't burn me again.

Reviews.Title: So disappointed
Reviews.Author: Maggiw
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set in March 2008 after doing A LOT of homework.  I researched the Sony brand and this model in particular through Consumer Reports.  I also read all the reviews I could find on the internet including here on Amazon.  Everyone raved about it and Consumer Reports said it was a good buy.  Well, here I am 2 and half years later with a busted tv that needs repair.  I am so disappointed!  I paid A LOT of money - hard earned money! - on this only to have it lose it's picture just two years later.  The repairman told me it was the 3rd Sony he saw that day!  The picture isn't clear, it's very hard to describe, but it looks like boxes on the screen.  The repairman said that it could be either the board that is loose which would cost approximately $300 to fix with parts and labor OR it could be the entire panel which would cost too much to repair and it would make more sense to buy a new set.  I wish I could reach Sony and tell them that this is UNACCEPTABLE!  I paid $3k for this television through Amazon!  Boy, they saw me coming a mile a away!

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY IT!  LASTED 2 YEARS - THEN DIED
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Chambers "Dixie Chambers"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV 2 years ago.  We love the quality of the picture and had no problems with it.  UNTIL a month ago the picuture started going  crazy, dark spots, overlapping, awful.We paid $90 to have it checked out, to find that it needed a new panel, which would cost OVER $3,000.00 TO FIX!!!!!  We didnt' pay that much for it to begin with!!!  When I called Sony they told me it "wasn't worth fixing" and they would give me a discount on a new TV!!!!!  ARE YOU SERIOUS!!!!!  I am furious with SONY.  WHAT A RIP OFF.

Reviews.Title: High Qualiy product from Sony, it's been a while since..
Reviews.Author: OI
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. Excellent HDTV video quality. Very good Standard picture (not many TVs of this size can do that). Initial TV configuration is not very straight forward, but once figured - picture is amazing. I wish all Sony products to be like that.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Louis Hsiao "Worldisflat"
Reviews.Content: After dealing with a "less-than-reputable" dealer online for the Sony XBR, I decided to go with Amazon's source for my 52" Sony XBR4.  I got a very fair price and excellent delivery service.  Communication about the status was excellent and they delivered the TV in a timely manner.  The TV is just breathtaking.  I purchased a 50" Sony plasma TV years ago and am amazed by the technological improvements in picture quality in just a couple of years.  The picture quality and detail are so sharp that it almost looks 3D up on that large 52" screen. Again, I have no regrets going with the Sony knowhow.

Reviews.Title: Great Expectations!
Reviews.Author: John E. Hughes "oil man"
Reviews.Content: I recently made my biggest purchase ever from Amazon---a sony XBR4 lcd.  I was worried that it may be damaged in shipment, but FED EX did a great job!  There wasn't a scratch on the box.The TV is amazing and lives up to it's high CR rating.  I bought an lcd because our room has plenty of windows and lcd's do better in well lit rooms.The HD picture is awesome thru Direct TV satelite. As you can surmise,I have been well pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: R. G. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: No complaints whatsoever - great product - delivery was superb and on time as promised.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-52XBR4
Reviews.Author: Dean Backside
Reviews.Content: No problems at all. Item was ordered and delivered on time. It came FedEx Ground delivery on top of a pallet. The driver dropped it off in my garage. We removed the top of the box (it lifts straight up and off the TV) and performed a visual inspection. No obvious defects observed. Neighbor helped me carry upstairs and mount onto a TV stand. Picture looks great. No dead or damaged pixels. I was nervous about making a purchase of this kind on-line, but now, I am a believer! And I saved about $600.00 in total price and sales tax.

Reviews.Title: It's a Sony - What can you say!!
Reviews.Author: J. M. Shannon
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to review the TV because all the good stuff you've read about the XBR is true.However, I am going to give a great big thumbs up to Amazon for their great white glove delivery. I was a little leary about buying this large ticket item online. I usually buy from a local TV shop. This time I couldn't pass up the fantastic price offered by Amazon which includes white glove delivery. The delivery people unpacked the TV, set it up where I wanted it, ensured that it worked properly, and removed all the packing material before they left.If you find the price at Amazon attractive, don't let concerns about shipping and setup keep you from buying this TV from them.

Reviews.Title: The other reviews were right on!
Reviews.Author: A. Gimenez
Reviews.Content: I have had this HDTV for about a month now. The picture and clarity is simply amazing. I have read reviews upon reviews online about it, but its just not the same as seeing it in person. About the only thing I can really ad to everyone's comments is that it was packaged very very well from the factory and the operating instructions seem pretty straight forward. The only downsides are possibly the huge box you are stuck getting rid of and of course the price tag. Their are also a bunch of little added features within the menus if you look hard enough. The matching stand (Sony SU-FL300L)is a nice touch as well.On a side note...If you happen to buy this in person at a store, check the manufacture date (Month/Year) in the back. Good thing to know if its been sitting in a warehouse for a while, or was just recently made!

Reviews.Title: awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Y
Reviews.Content: I too researched tvs for a long time before buying the 52XBR4. I also just bought the Samsung LNT4069FX and the Sony KDL-32S3000. The XBR4 does a much better job with standard def content, although the 8300 HD/DVR box from TWCNYC is still pretty crappy. I haven't found any dead pixels or clouding. I caught a twenty eight hundred dollar deal directly from Amazon, which without tax or shipping is a great deal. Delivery was not white glove - the Eagle guys did not unpack or let me inspect the tv before leaving, but were kind enough to throw their McDonald's trash on my front lawn. BTW, the LNT does have the triple-ball effect.

Reviews.Title: BEST OF THE BEST
Reviews.Author: e
Reviews.Content: This is by far the finest picture you will get period!My Samsung 71 series is very close, but the XBR-4 series just plain rocks. Love my 52" XBR-4.Update/ one red pix after 31 days. Too late to return and Sony will not fix it. ARGH!

Reviews.Title: 52xbr4 and comcast hdmi
Reviews.Author: J. D. Jefferson "book maven"
Reviews.Content: i have had the xbr4-52" for 5 days now. i am connected to my comcast hd receiver via hdmi cable (waiting for arrival of panasonic blu-ray dvd player soon). picture is incredible and worked right out of the box, no problems. i went to "[...]" and picked up some excellent tips on setting up the xbr4 (there are numerous comments). a bit of caution though, stay away from "vivid" settings and create your on "cinema" or "custom" and try to keep "backlight" as low as possible to extend life of the led lamps (3-5). you will love this set.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Merle Ensign "boschzm"
Reviews.Content: We continue to be amazed by this tv. The clarity and brightness is beyond belief. It is everything advertised and more. It must be seen to believe.

Reviews.Title: sony sucks
Reviews.Author: frank in oracle "frank"
Reviews.Content: Bought the Sony kdl52xbr4 about 9 mo. ago. The set worked fine for the first few months then the picture developed green splotches all over. Called Sony service and they gave me two options for repair places, one would not come out and the other needed two weeks before they could look at tv. They finally came and looked, they called sony and sony recommendedtwo different parts. Took another two weeks to get parts and have them installed, they did not help at all. Another call to Sony.. this time they said the set would need complete new screen which was on back order.A month went by before repair shop recieved the screen, and another two weeks to schedule replacement. After screen was replaced the tv worked fairly well but picture was some what fuzzy, about three hours after repairmen left the tv went completely blank, no sound and no picture.After much complaining to Sony customer service they finally agreed to replace the tv with a referbished tv. So far three months have passed since I have been fighting with Sony customer service to resolve this problem.Hope the replacement tv works. No more sony products for me.

Reviews.Title: Defective display panel.
Reviews.Author: H. Shen "shl"
Reviews.Content: This TV works fine for the first 4 months, then a vertical dead line appeared and propagated every day.Called the Repair center and realized this is a typical problem for this TV. Now it is Olympic time and I have no TV to watch!Simply DO NOT buy this TV. If you really want to give it a shot, buy it with extended warranty.I am lucky since this TV broke down while still covered under warranty. If not, be prepared for another $2000+ for the display panel replacement.BTW, as mentioned by someone before, SONY custom service is a disaster!

Reviews.Title: Verticle line of dead pixel
Reviews.Author: A. M. Pradhan "eplur"
Reviews.Content: I have had this unit for about 3 months now, loved it so far, great pictures, easy to use. 480i pictures actually looks better on this TV than any other televisions I have seen. Yesterday however, I noticed a strip of vertical line on the dead center of the TV that spans from the top to the bottom. It has to be a few pixels wide because I can see it from 25 feet away. So, I called the customer service number listed on the menu, they are going to send an authorized repair person to get it checked out. I am happy with the service, but not happy with the investment choice I made. I paid twice as much for this TV thinking I will not have to go through these product defects.I will update this post after the authorized personal from Sony looks at it on July 1st.------------------------------------------------------------------------Got a call from the Sony authorized dealer, they are ordering the LCD panel, will arrive in about two weeks.------------------------------------------------------------------------After the panel was replaced, this TV is now what it is originally supposed to be. Great TV, great customer support ... Metal Gear Solid 4 on PS3 looks awesome.Back to 5 stars :)

Reviews.Title: Great HD Performance - Much better than the Sony Bravia KDL-52W3000
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Emmons
Reviews.Content: This TV delivers all that it promises. The HD picture performance is significantly superior to the Sony Bravia KDL-52W3000 52-inch 1080p LCD HDTV (I have had both TVs). Any extra cost for this TV is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: KDL-52XBR4 Review
Reviews.Author: R. Parks
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars is more appropriate.  The picture with HD sources is awesome.  It does very well with DVDs and even converts cable tv to good pictures.  Motion is crisp and clear, the only time it's noticable seems to be on things like cartoons (Toon Disney and Cartoon Network), HD sports are phenomenal.  Controls are logical, but remote is bigger than necessary.  Would like to have had an ieee 1394 input for the video camera.  Extremely good black levels for an LCD.

Reviews.Title: It's Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Lenny
Reviews.Content: There's so many good things to say about it, I'm not sure where to start.  It's big.  It's beautiful.  Quality is outstanding.Pros: EVERYTHINGCons: none that I've found after 3+ months (and I've looked)

Reviews.Title: Looks are everything... great picture, great aesthetics, great TV!
Reviews.Author: P. Siegel "biciclista"
Reviews.Content: We recently upgraded our TV from a 10-year-old Sony 32" XBR TV to the Sony 52" KDLXBR4 LCD.  The TV is fantastic!  After having to move out of the house for a major renovation, we swore we would not move the old TV back in, which, with stand, weighed 200 lbs and took three guys to move it.  The new Sony arrived, and two guys moved it into place quickly and efficiently, and it powered up perfectly.  So simple, easy and effortless (for me!).Although it does come with a stand, we had our installer hang it on the wall, into which was placed a conduit for the TV's cords to connect to the receiver.  (Note: if you are doing home renovation, be sure to put a power outlet on the wall near where you're going to hang it, otherwise, you'll have a power cord dangling down.  Doh!)The TV has a nice set of speakers, and quite a few inputs (including 3 HDMI inputs, I think).  However, if you're setting it up in a home theater, all these inputs and speakers go to waste, as you'll only be using one HDMI input into which you'll plug the output of your receiver.  Essentially the TV turns into an LCD monitor.  But if you are intending to use it as a standalone TV, the speakers are excellent, as is the remote, and it has enough inputs to handle all your equipment.Setting up the TV is a breeze, with the onscreen setup and the remote.  As I said earlier, the remote control is really nicely laid out and easy to use.  But if you are setting up a home theater, you'll probably get a universal remote so it won't matter.The look of the TV was very important to me -- when it hangs on the wall, it becomes a piece of furniture.  The look is very clean and unobtrusive.  The outer bezel is clear and you can buy additional colored bezels if you want to jazz it up.  It fits very nicely in my minimalist modern home.The picture quality is superb.  I don't yet have any HD input sources to connect to it (but expect to soon), but my receiver is an upconverting receiver so it converts lower-resolution signals to higher resolution to give you a great quality picture.The only thing that I wished I really knew was how much of the TV's functionality would be taken over by the other piece of equipment.  It would have been great to just buy the equivalent LCD monitor if they sold it.All in all, I'm very pleased with the TV and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Best TV Ever
Reviews.Author: Gregory J. George "ocncapt"
Reviews.Content: I have looked for a long time trying to get the best LCD TV I could. For quite awhile I was going to buy the SHARP AQUOS. I heard about this new SONY coming out and decided to give it a look. I was "wowed" by the picture. Comparing the SHARP and SONY side by side the SONY definitely has the edge with their newest technology. My friends have come over to the house and are mesmorized by the high quality picture. Even on a standard channel the TV upgrades the picture. Watching a Blu-Ray movie on it makes it almost 3-D. Just fantastic!!! One other thing, I had looked at many of the usual outlets (Fry's, Best Buy, Circuit City ect," and when I looked at AMAZON.com, they were $500 cheaper than the rest. Plus with no shipping charge and no tax it became an incredible value buy.

Reviews.Title: UNBELIEVABLE!
Reviews.Author: Pseudoname "Author"
Reviews.Content: I have had XBR TVs since SONY introduced them years ago.  It is the flagship of the SONY line.  SONY makes the professional cameras used by most major broadcasters.  It understands what the signals are that originate at broadcasters.  This translates into a clear understanding of what software is needed and what technologies are needed to display them.  Other than Phillips, no one else on the planet does.  They are all wannabes.  I have the 52XBR4 with the SONY DX500 surround sound, wireless rear speaker kit, WII, and SONY S500 Blu-Ray.  What a dream to setup; the Bravia interconnection is flawless.  Don't read the other whiner reviews, read the manual.  It is clear how to use this TV.  The controls are incredible over what you can do with this machine - and easy to use.  May cost a little more - it's priceless what you get for it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: C. Husted
Reviews.Content: This was the best online purchase I have ever made, and I purchase a lot of products online. The shipping was FREE and it was FAST (arrived in 3days). We saved almost $1000 compared to Best Buy and RC Willey, and the delivery was faster than purchasing local. The new Sony is absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Sony TV
Reviews.Author: C. Barnes
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV.  The picture is great.  No regrets whatsoever.  We did a lot of research before hand, and this television is more than we hoped for.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: JEFFREY WAWRZYNEK
Reviews.Content: One of the best pictures I have ever seen!!!  Make sure that you get a high def connection from your cable company....it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: Worry Free TV!
Reviews.Author: Books4Me
Reviews.Content: This TV is more expensive than an equivalent Samsung but I didn't want to have a bad mail order experience with a TV this size.  The delivery was excellent; I was allowed to set it up and plug it in to check the picture.  There were no missing pixels at all.  Everything works as expected; we have a Sony DVD player with an HDMI output and the HDMI connection works well.  The upconversion from the DVD player to the TV looks incredible.  It was ALMOST HD quality; Blu-ray still looks better but that's to be expected.  From what I have seen, the 120Hz feature is worth the money especially for movie lovers with a large TV.

Reviews.Title: Excelent image and colors, well above Samsung
Reviews.Author: Domingo J. Guerra Garza "djguerra"
Reviews.Content: As many others in this threads, I researched many TV sets before making my purchase decision.  This Sony Bravia XBR KDL-52XBR4 set is one of the best among Sony's TV product's line.  There's also the KDL-52XBR5, which is more expensive, but the  (cosmetic) differences, in my opinion, do not justify the added expense.The image, the tonality of the colors and the sound are just great.  I think this Bravia XBR set is better than the latest of the Samsungs.  I am very happy with my purchase decision, specially after I bought the Sony Blu-ray BDP-S500 player.  You need to see the extraordinary images these two can produce.

Reviews.Title: Great HD TV!
Reviews.Author: J. Ward
Reviews.Content: I knew that this Sony model was a great TV but never expected how good it is until I used it. It's picture is excellent in HD and very good for digital and regular TV on Comcast cable. Controls are easy to use. Also a good computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: Bravo for Bravia
Reviews.Author: M. Gallagher "Tiki Man"
Reviews.Content: We have had our new Sony Bravia for about 3 weeks and love it.  It has many ways to adjust the picture so that it's the best.  The screen is good at not reflectng much light, but there is some minor reflection opposite a big window.  The bright screen counteracts this well.  We bought Monster's best HDMI cable to be sure to handle the bandwidth needed for the 120mhz refresh rate and the 1080p resolution.  We'd definitely recommend this HDTV to others.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the wait for shipping
Reviews.Author: J. Agosta
Reviews.Content: This TV is fabulous.  The color and clarity is superb.  After viewing it for a week I have had no desire to try to change any of the factory adjustments.  The "white glove" delivery was excellent and included placing the unit on its stand and checking for functionality and any damage.  This unit replaced a seven year old 35 inch Sony tube set that still works fine.  I'm sold on Sony and the service and pricing from Amazon.  I saved $700 over Best Buy's on sale out the door price.

Reviews.Title: Sony LCD
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: I deliberated heavily on whether to purchase the Sony Bravia XBR or Samsung version of the LCD w/120 auto-motion plus feature. Ultimately I went with the Sony after reading several reviews from both on Amazon. I am very happy with my decision. The deciding factor was that there were no complaints about Sony's LCD having pixel problems like the Samsung.  must admit though that after checking the 2 out in the stores (Circuit City and Best Buy), Samsung seemed to have a better picture, sharper. The Sony wasn't bad but side-by-side you can see with the naked eye. Maybe I just like shinier, who knows. BUT, to spend that amount of money I want reliability hence Sony. Again, I have no complaints. To each their own but thus far, Sony has been great.

Reviews.Title: Excellant product
Reviews.Author: Neil P. Whyte
Reviews.Content: Excellent HD picture, some motion problems but no worse than others. I do not notice on DVD material, more of a cable HD issuse somewhat. Great color and blacks. Have a samsung in other room and Sony wins. Many options so the people who have picture problems have not look at the many adjustments. Many tweaks to the picture, so you can mess it up. Very happy

Reviews.Title: Still pondering DLP?
Reviews.Author: J. G. Bookout "Gadget Boy"
Reviews.Content: I have a Mitsubishi 65831 and was pondering the 73733 model as an additional model.  I was concerned with the color wheel as my eyes are VERY sensitive (I am blessed), and seeing DLP vs. plasma vs. LCD in-store (Fry's) I made the following observations:DLPpro - BIG! Relatively cheap!con - Color wheel, contrastPlasmapro - Contrast, colorscon - Screen door effect, size constraintsLCDpro - Contrast, colors, selectioncon - Price, size constraintsTo summarize, the bigger the NOT better.  Putting a plasma or LCD next to a DLP is night and day - almost literally.  The DLP sets cannot deliver the richness of colors the other formats provide.  I can very clearly see the pixels in all plasma sets, which is a deal breaker, not to mention the publicized power consumption and burn-in.  The Sony 52XBR4/5 is the class of the field in my opinion (The Sharp is VERY close).  I am very happy with my purchase and would rather watch the 52" LCD over my 65" Mitsu.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and Amazon service!
Reviews.Author: L. Truong "SonyHDNADonor"
Reviews.Content: After owning this television for a month now, I can't be any happier about my purchase.  The HD LCD picture is amazing with my PlayStation 3 Blu-Ray and DirecTV HD receiver.  Amazon's prices can't be beat since they also have a 30-day price guarantee.  My experience with Eagle shipping was also excellent.  I highly recommend you getting this television if you're still on the fence about it.  You'll only regret NOT getting it!

Reviews.Title: waited 2 long 4 a broken t.v
Reviews.Author: Juan I. Macias
Reviews.Content: it took 5 week for it 2show up(i had 2 call them 3 times) then 3 weeks  it broke.then it took another 3 weeks to get it fix

Reviews.Title: Great picture for the first three months
Reviews.Author: Charles Krugh
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in Dec. 07. For the first three months, it looked fantastic.  I then noticed a small vertical blue line forming towards the bottom of the screen.  As the days passed, the line grew and is now about four inches!  I'm on hold right now with Sony to get the problem resolved.  I hope that I'll have good news to report re their customer service and warranty support. UPDATE: It took three weeks, but Sony honored their warranty-no questions asked.  A service provider delivered a new screen to my home and installed it in less than one hour.  Very impressive!

Reviews.Title: useless tv after 20 months
Reviews.Author: bert merced
Reviews.Content: bought it in feb08 and the screen just was all jumbled. half was almost normal and the other was zoomed in. sent it to sony repair center and they said cheaper to buy a new one. wtf $3000 down the drain after 20 months!

Reviews.Title: After 9 months the blacks have sever bleeding. Artifacting. Sony does nothing for warranty.
Reviews.Author: Tech Test Pilot
Reviews.Content: I've owned this 52 inch LCD tv Since May 2008 from an authorized Sony dealer. Its initial quality was nothing less than spectacular. Deep blacks. No bleeding. Exceptional clarity. Breathtaking colors. It was registered for warranty the same day online with Sony's website.Over the last three weeks, I noticed SEVERE bleeding of the blacks during any tv or movie and when it's a blank screen. I've seen an odd double blur around actors and objects (artifacting?). It does Not leave a trail like ghosting. I've tried switching all of my video/audio equipment without success.I called Sony to come out to repair. They blew me off for three weeks. After getting tired of my 3 times a day calling, they sent a guy out. He said YES my problems were legitimate... BUT IT'S NOT COVERED UNDER WARRANTY! I am extremely upset at Sony and their business practice. A friend of mine has the 42" version and is beginning to show the same faults. He bought a third party warranty and got his tv repaired. Is this the beginning of SONY's fall from grace? Check their tanking stock price and see how much money they lost for fiscal year 2008.

Reviews.Title: If you want the best ...
Reviews.Author: D. J. Walters
Reviews.Content: Every possible feature, every possible input.Rated #1 by "a leading consumer magazine"

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jon H
Reviews.Content: I bought this several years ago now, but it's still one of the best TV's I've seen.  The size is perfect and the picture is great.  Many useful features but some are a little confusing or not necessary.  Still an awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: double image problem
Reviews.Author: J. Mato "JM"
Reviews.Content: We've owned our Sony Bravia XBR KDL-52XBR4 since 2008.  Over the last 6 months, a "double image" problem has crept up on our tv that disappears after the tv warms up for 15 minutes or so.  You can do a quick google search and discover that this is a problem on older Bravias.  The solution, at least for my TV, is to replace the T-Conn board.  That's several hundred bucks.  just make sure you do your research before you buy.  We paid premium 2008 money for this TV and i do not want to replace it just yet, so we live with the problem.

Reviews.Title: This TV is great when it works
Reviews.Author: Jason Burrell "Poncho"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this TV broke right after the warranty was finished. It is a terrible TV and the folks at Sony where just rude about it. I will never buy another Sony product again and advise you all not to either. Crap products.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: The TV picture is awesome but the built-in speakers are awful.  You definitely need surround sound or some other additional sound amplification.

Reviews.Title: Buyer
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Not as good as Sony.  Paid $3000.00 for only good for 3 years Now the picture quality very bad it is total lost, one side of tv have double picture.  Any one know how to fix it?

Reviews.Title: Display Panel problems
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Dykstra
Reviews.Content: After reviewing both the Sony XBR-4 and the Sharp Aquos, I choose the Sony even though it was more money, based on the Sony brand name.  After 14 months the picture started goiong out but would come back to normal after the set warmed up.  After a couple months of this the picture took longeer and longer to go back to normal until I finally called a service rep.  I was told the display panel needed to be replaced, at a cost greater than what I had spent on the original set and oh by the way the panel was no longer available.  spony was of absolutely no help in resolving this issue and I will do what I can to never buy a Sony product again, I espically will not pay a premium for another Sony product (if they make pace makers, maybe, but.....)

Reviews.Title: Excellent 'No Glare' in Window Filled Room
Reviews.Author: C. Baldwin "Groove"
Reviews.Content: This TV is now over a year old and we love it as much as the day we pulled it out of the box.  We had tried a 58" Samsung plazma that was beautiful, but our bank of west facing windows in bright 300+ Colorado sunny days simply did not agree with the mirror like reflective glass of plazma.  I really wanted that 58" to work and have been accused of being a Sony guy opposed to a 'Sammy ?' guy.  I didn't know there were those kind of people out there.  This 52" Sony handles the sunny bright Colorado bank of windows incredibly well 'with absolutely no glare'...ever.  Full curtains drawn or not.  I would have never believed it!  While I wouldn't think twice about a plazma for a 'darker' room with low light and no glare, to get those super deep blacks, this TV is breath taking, and grabs our attention with it's outstanding HD pictures.  And no, I'm not a Sony guy opposed to a "Sammy" guy, whatever that is supposed to mean.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect
Reviews.Author: J. D.
Reviews.Content: Like other Sony products I have ever had (plasma TV, camcorders, cameras, laptops, etc.), this is no doubt another great one. I bought it earlier this year and everyone in my family just love it. No complaints. But it would be perfect if the P&P; function could work just like my old Sony TV which allows me to watch two different TV channels at the same time instead of one TV channel and the video. Nothing's perfect, though.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Joel "Joel"
Reviews.Content: I bought this a year ago and it is working great. Amazon's White Glove service was good. The TV arrived in a timely way during the Holidays and I helped the driver unload it, because he showed up without a partner. He was apologetic, and I was happy to get the unit in time for the Holidays.  Bottom line, the TV is incredible. I was deciding between this and the 52" Samsung because of the lower price and similar high end technologies. The Sony name and design won me over, however, forget about good customer service from Sony, as they are terrible. Thank goodness the TV works so well, and hopefully I wont need additional help from them.  The TV is awesome and has some terrific features. The TV's only weakness, from my point of view, is that there aren't enough HDMI ports (2 on back, 1 on side) and there is no input for DVI, just RGB (which I'm told is analog). I highly recommend this TV. You'll wow people and have lots of hours of great entertainment too. Make sure you get a strong mount if you plan to hang this on your wall as it weighs nearly 100 lbs. I bought the Omni mount dual cantilever on Amazon and it is proving to be very sturdy for the task.

Reviews.Title: Happy with My Sony
Reviews.Author: Notsofasteddie
Reviews.Content: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-52XBR4 52-Inch 1080p LCD HDTVIt's been here a month now and we are all more than pleased with our new TV. The color is great and the high definition is definitely high definition. Loved watching March Madness this past week and am looking forward to watching the Masters. The price was right! It took a week from purchase to delivery, the delivery man got the set up and running, and then took away the box. Who could ask for anything more?

Reviews.Title: Top performing LCD for HD television
Reviews.Author: Tough Critic
Reviews.Content: After viewing multiple TV's for the past year I finally found the Sony KDL-52XBR4 LCD set with a great picture for viewing high definition TV broadcasts. My family room is completely open on one end with windows from the kitchen letting natural daylight into the room. The Sony 52" XBR4 is much better than any other TV for rooms with windows as it has a matte screen that does not create a lot of annoying reflections. This is a major consideration with a large screen TV. I found that Plasma TV's are particularly prone to this problem and perform better in a room without any windows.My other major consideration is how good the picture looks when viewing HDTV broadcasts. I do not watch many DVD's so that was a lower priority for me. The SONY XBR4 is fantastic when viewing HD programs. You need to spend plenty of time adjusting the picture under daytime conditions and night conditions to get the best performance. This set allows you to tweak the picture with more than a dozen adjustments and you can save your settings. I have separate settings for daytime, nighttime and sports.I am very happy with this unit and when I visit friends I always try and check out their big screen TV picture. To date I have not found another TV that can match the picture on the Sony KDL-52XBR4. This TV was a major investment and it is pricey ($3,000) but I am glad I waited.One final piece of advice: do not judge TV's by the way they look in a retail store or warehouse club. Retailers often use video processors and Blu-ray DVD's to showcase an incredible picture and you want to view the TV hooked directly to cable or satellite, to duplicate the same conditions in your home.

Reviews.Title: XBR KDL-52XBR4 52" LCD HDTV What a great televisioion-you won't be disappointed!
Reviews.Author: IrishS01
Reviews.Content: Sony Bravia XBR KDL-52XBR4 52-Inch 1080p LCD HDTVThis tv is better than advertised!  I'd done quite a bit of research and after reading all of the reviews decided on the Sony 52XBR4.  I was apprehensive about buying something this expensive online but I've always had great service through Amazon so I took the plunge.Amazon pricing was among the best around and the free white glove delivery was a bonus.  The tv arrived earlier than expected by over a week.  Delivery service was excellent.Whe I plugged it in and hooked up my HD DVR, we were in awe of the picture.  It was better than anything we'd seen in stores and exceeded our expectations.  The picture is unbelievable with this full-featured HDTV.After a recent experience with a 42 inch plasma television,we decided to purchase an extended warranty and after some research found it can be purchased directly through Sony.  A 4 year in-home extended warranty was $329 - signifcantly less than some other on-lne aftermarket companies.  If you are interested in extending your warranty, I recommend checking with Sony directly.In conclusion, I've never been caught up in the Sony brand name quest but I am a new convert.  You will not be disappointed with this TV!!!!!!!  It is worth every single penny.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia XBR  KDL - 52XBR 52" LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: SweetP2
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV out there for the $$$$.  No need to pay more for the piano black.....they are the same TV!  Fabulous color and HD picture.  We are mounting ours to the wall.  You won't be sorry with this TV.  You will enjoy watching every minute of TV on this one!  Easy set up, shipping box is easy to lift, and the TV is easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: This television is amazing
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Balfe "Bobs Review"
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt this is the best television I have ever owned.  Anyone who sees my television is absolutely amazed.  I bought this at Best Buy who actually matched my company discount - where I would have had to order it online to get the discounted price.

Reviews.Title: Best LCD on the market
Reviews.Author: J. Pastor
Reviews.Content: This is the best LCD HDTV on the market.  It is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great picture Delivery not so great
Reviews.Author: G. F. Mc Cann
Reviews.Content: I find the unit fabulous. However the delivery was almost a disaster.I was told by the freight company when they called to schedule delivery that 2 people would show up to unpack and set unit up in the room but only one driver showed up in the rain with no hand truck and had to struggle to get the unit up a flight of stairs all alone. I am not physically capable of helping. I finally had to help the driver lift the unit up to the stand.  The driver however was great and we managed to get job done.

Reviews.Title: Perfect and Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: Mary S. Venable "charltonsilvey"
Reviews.Content: I bought this via amazon for about 3K in 2008 and have never regretted it. This is a perfect TV although I know Sony is no longer producing it. It is still the most beautiful TV produced if that is important to you. This set is just astounding and will blow you away.

Reviews.Title: How can you not fall in love with this ?
Reviews.Author: Srinivas Katta "cyberdentist"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in Dec 07 for an incredible price of $2650 after taxes from local Best Buy when they were running a special! Prior to that, I had researched and bought several 52" TV's and have been disappointed by their performance. I went through Philips, Sharp and then settled for Sony.Sharp - severe banding issues. Sharp even replaced my TV twice before they completely refunded the amount after almost 2 months of purchase! Go to AVS forums and look for threads on Sharp TV's and you will invariably see several people who have experienced the same. However, Sharp had the best styling and design. Plus their customer service Rocks. Sad that a one time leader in LCD's is now considered amongst the worstPhilips - No picture artifacts but there was no back light adjustment and the colors didn't pop!In the end after researching Samsung & Sony, I finally decided on the 52 XBR and after 6 months of usage, I am totally satisfied by my investment!Pros:- SD TV looks incredible on this machine- I love the XMB interface- Extreme picture customization options- Super looking after mounting- 120Hz of course turn it off for normal viewing but enable it when you watch sports or play PS3! - YOU WILL SEE THE DIFFERENCE- No reflection whatsoever!Cons:- Very heavy- Thick (in a way its good as it gives you room to play with at the back for connections- PriceyFor anyone on the fringe - Don't think twice, just buy the XBR. Stick with XBR4 and save some money over XBR5For anyone who can wait - XBR6/7/8 line is due out by Aug/Sept 08. Wait till then to see the prices on XBR 4/5 drop!

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia HD TV
Reviews.Author: Lewis E. Howell
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible HD TV. Sony really produced a winner.It is a beautiful piece of furniture with the glass surround and what a beautiful picture it produces, ( both HD as well as standard format)Our neighbor viewed it and ordered one exactly like ours.Our living room where this is placed is bright with outside light during daylight hours and the mat finish on Sony's screen obscures this and plays extremely well.Thanks SONY

Reviews.Title: ITS JUST LIKE A DOM PERIGNON, SIMPLY THE BEST!!!!
Reviews.Author: HDguru "HDguru"
Reviews.Content: Ive always loved Sony TV's going way back to the 80's. What i love is there attention to making the highest quality screens money can buy!! I bought one of the first flat screen Sony's back when they were analog models, and even then the Sony screens were the best. When i unwrapped this gorgeous Sony 52 LCD xbr4 from the box, and i just smelled the aromas coming from the packaging, and i smelled quality again. This is a TV James Bond might use!!I wanted a tv with NO glare, and this stomps all over those pesky little plasma screens, and those samsung glare LCD's...I can watch in the daytime and nighttime without a glare in sight! When i use my Sony PS3 to play blu ray discs, boy is the picture unbelievable. It makes you wonder why you would ever pay all that money to see a movie in the theatres..Save your money and buy this set. Im glad i didnt spend that 12000 bucks on the qualia tvs cuz essentially this is a qualia disguised as an xbr...

Reviews.Title: BRAVO Bravia... The Ultimate Experience.
Reviews.Author: Rienzi "The Righteous"
Reviews.Content: Being an educated shopper with some knowledge of electronics in general, I ventured out there in search of the best value and best viewing experience. After some research it came down to the Samsung "Aquos" and Sony "Bravia" and after more analysis, the Sony "Bravia" won my choice.Once settled, it came to the part of a hassle free shopping experience. Considering all the technical information provided here at amazon, all the helpful reviews (thanks everyone for their input), price, delivery service and above all, seller's reliability (been an amazon customer for ages), I could not have gone anywhere but to shop right here. The transaction went as smooth as when buying a DVD or a book..Amazon processed and shipped the item with the same efficiency you would expect from the very best (no, I do not work for amazon, just a happy customer). The white glove service provided was professional and helpful and in no time I had my TV at the designated place and the rest was just a push of a button away.The feeling of accomplishment and satisfaction was overwhelming when I looked at this gorgeous and elegant piece of technology delivering a fantastic movie experience. I'm hooked for life.BRAVO Sony! BRAVO amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: Just too Good
Reviews.Author: Gregory R. Hollebeke "Golf Ape"
Reviews.Content: My new 52" XBR-4 replace a 40" Bravia.  I got XBR4 over XBR5 because of cost and free white glove delvery.  Just do it.

Reviews.Title: Looks beautiful
Reviews.Author: B. Pate
Reviews.Content: The set looks stunning.  I can't comment about many of the new features since I am waiting for an appropriate HD DVD or Blueray player, but even my old-school DVD player looks amazing on this screen.

Reviews.Title: vertical line
Reviews.Author: Steve Garrison
Reviews.Content: Went to Best buy to check out a blue ray player so a xbr 52 sony on the wall with vertical lines from top to bottom, so the problem is still with us!

Reviews.Title: Best LCD Full HDTV on the Market!
Reviews.Author: H. Rodas
Reviews.Content: Well I had a projection Mitsubishi TV (73") and it died on me. I was young when my dad bought it so I didnt know much about TV's back then so I couldnt have told him what TV to buy.  Anyways onto the topic. I got this TV almost a month ago and I have to say this TV is just so amazing. The picture just still amazes me and the sound is unbelievable. Also if your into video games then this is the TV to get! I have a PS3 and XBOX360 and man does the picture just amaze me even more. I get butter flys in my stomach just thinking about it HAHA. If there is one TV you want to buy its a Sony Bravia thats for sure. Best TV's on the market in my opinion right now. If I was rich I would buy that 72" Sony Bravia but believe it or not its freaking $32,000 USD's! One day ill win the lottery and get it haha (dreaming). So yea I give this TV a 10 star! not a 5 star!.  Worth buying and great price. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Top Of the Line TV
Reviews.Author: D. W. Woods
Reviews.Content: This TV is the best that I have ever watched.  It may not be the biggest screen, but if there is a TV out there with a better picture, I do not know which one it would be.  I could not be more pleased then I am.  Sony did a great job when they build this.  If you are looking for the best, then look no farther, you have found it.  Great picture and a great sound even without an a/v receiver hooked up.  You cannot beat the price that Amazon has on it.  They shipped it with white glove treatment.  The shipper brought it into the house, unpacked it and let me check it out.  Great job from start to finish.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Burned by Sony again "Burned by Sony again"
Reviews.Content: 7/22/08:Just going into week 7 of my new TV,the picture/display was gone. Sony repairman says he has to order a new FB1 mainboard. TV was always connected to a good APC line conditioner/ surge protector, so I doubt any external forces caused the failure. Retailer no help after 30 days, have to go through manufacturer warranty(cringe). 5 years ago, Sony demanded 3 attempts to fix my new home theatre receiver. That took 8 months and never was fixed. Only then did they ship a new unit. But that was 8 months without a unit! With 3K into this TV, I better not go through that again, but willing to bet I do.8/6/08:Well guess what. Sony replaces FB1 board today and presto, no picture! Now they will try 2 other parts that will take another 2 weeks to install with no guarantees they will fix problem. I guess no diagnosing here, just throw parts at it till something magically works. This TV sucks.And so does Sony. Here we go again. Needless to say, I don't do Sony again in my lifetime. And I so wanted to watch the Olympic games on this set! No going to happen.Buy something else!

Reviews.Title: LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Curtiss
Reviews.Content: i PURCHASED THE TV FROM AMAZON. The estimated date of receipt was two weeks and I received the TV in one week. It was easy to track with the numbers amason gives you. Very good service and product + price.

Reviews.Title: Tosh Vs. Samsung Vs. Sony - guess who won?
Reviews.Author: Sathia
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the decision to buy the 52XBR4:===========================================I have a Olevia 37" LCD (537H) which was moved from the bedroom into the family room after I sold off the 46" Sony RPTV. I had been eyeing the latest 1080P, 120Hz TVs for a while now, and had narrowed down my choice to1. Toshiba2. Samsung3. SonyI went with Toshiba due to the value for the money (or so I thought) - they seemed to match the other sets feature by feature except were $500 or so less. I went ahead and bought the set (from local retailer - video only; sorry Amazon, not about to buy a fragile 52" TV online! - which turned out to be a good decision, read on). I got the Toshiba XF550 which is their top-end 52" model. Was happy with it until I realized my Oppo player via HDMI looked way too green especially in the shadow areas. After trying to "fix" it, I returned the set failing to do so (didnt try the service menu tricks, for fear of voiding warranty, return issues, etc.). The off-axis viewing was also not very good on this one. It was a real bummer because I really liked its thin bezel, and styling. Plus, i had to haul it back to the shop to exchange it...So I was back on the market... in the meanwhile, more research about Samsung showed 2 things - 1) TBE (Triple Ball Effect) in their 120Hz models; 2) 8bit vs. 10 bit confusion because Samsung doesnt provide specs for their panels *anywhere*. Also the model I looked at (A650) was not attractive (subjective) due to its reddish bezel, glare-ish screen (I have a large window facing the TV), etc.So I looked at Sony - it had been my 3rd choice mostly due to their price point for their higher end / 50+" models. Finally decided XBR is what I want - here are the pluses:1. 120Hz (best implementation in the market)2. very good blacks (although I think not as good as Samsungs - the glare screen ones)3. excellent off-axis viewing (black level drop very slightly on extreme horiz-off-axis viewing)4. styling (it looks much bigger than the Toshiba; but I really like the glass surround, very elegant)5. 10bit panel6. High WAF (Wife Acceptance Factor)Review of the set itself===========================================I love the set so far. Mine was a March 2008 build. It looks unbelievable when matching up with my Oppo 981 DVD player upconverting to 1080P. I did have to tune it to get good blacks (e.g. Power Saving must be a High, and backlight at min/1). Video-only gave me a price lower than Amazon (sorry guys) and I also got the 2 yr warranty extension (total 3 years).High Def:---------Comcast HD channels look pretty good - the TV does show the artifacts that are present in the signal itself. Black levels are pretty good.The best HD source I got is via XBOX 360 (just trailers); now, they look good - I mean jaw-dropping good; I can only imagine how bluray movies will look. I am currently looking for a bluray player maybe later when prices drop and load times get better.Standard Def------------Standard def looks ok on this set; honestly between DVD, my xbox and Comcast's HD channels I barely watch any SD anymore.The "wow" factor is very high on this TV as well, if that matters to you - folks went gaga in my recent party drooling all over the set.

Reviews.Title: Reseller Vanns Shipping Policy
Reviews.Author: Arun Biswas "neurojava"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV from Amazon.com and found that it was being shipped by VANNS, a reseller.I just got an email from them saying that the delivery of the TV is only going to be curbside and that they will NOT even deliver in the house and that they will charge extra for any extra service.Now, given that Amazon on top of the Electronics page diplays White Glove delivery on all TVs above 27" - I found this extremely disturbing - especially since I live alone and there is no chance in hell I am moving a 52" TV by myself.Called Amazon - the customer service rep was very categorical in saying that there was nothing she could do to help. Too bad, my Credit card had already been charged 3K.I find it astounding - and perhaps a little disturbing - that Amazon wouldnt display that their terms and conditions dont hold for resellers on the web page.Very disappointed. I spend a lot of money on Amazon and this is a first - on my biggest purchase.I am posting this here so future buyers can beware - they are not getting this in your house or setting it up- unless shipped directly from Amazon - and none of the top of the line SONY XBRs are.

Reviews.Title: TOO  MUCH HOLD ON
Reviews.Author: Elvis M. Ramon "TEAM EMRO"
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful television that will really amaze many people. I have always been on top of the high definition hysteria and for once there is finally a product that truely shows noticeable difference in picture quality.  To me samsung has been the absolute best a far as 1080p set with high color contrast. Now sony has made the absolute best 120 hertz 1080p set but it has a lot of blurr in the picture. I am using real hdmi 1.3 compliant cables, the sony str dg 2100 receiver and yet I cannot get a consistent good picture.  When movement of video becomes too fast it blurrs or looks as if image has a ghost.  Games are not good on here either.  Colors are either of dull (especially on game mode) or glitchy as if the tv is speeding up the image. Dont get me wrong it is an amazing picture when not blurring but from what I hear these problems are common for right now as it is somewhat a new technology.  Also the colors are not as vibrant as most 1080p set that now are 20000:1 color with 16 bit processors.  I wish I had holded on because I have as of april I have seen new sets from both sony and samsung that have dramatically corrected this problem.
